column2: select(id, dot, dob, gender, primary_lang, is_bilingual,
trial, set_chosen, count, set_asked, n_bunnies, n_lions) %>%
group_by(id, age_months, age_years, gender, primary_lang, is_bilingual,

`summarise()` has grouped output by 'id', 'age_months', 'age_years', 'gender', 'primary_lang', 'is_bilingual', 'stim_set', 'highest_count', 'knower_level'. You can override using the `.groups` argument.
